intro: Prumnopitys montana var. meridensis, commonly known as the Mexican white fir, is a coniferous tree native to high-altitude regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, conical shape and needle-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The tree produces small, cone-like structures that contain both male and female reproductive organs. It thrives in cool, moist climates and is often found in mountainous forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
